shortdesc.ph: Starts client-side audio recording with configuration.
Starts client-side audio recording and configures recording settings.
Starts client-side audio recording and configures the recording settings.

section.p:
The SDK supports recording audio on the client during a call. After calling this method, you can record the audio of users in the channel and obtain an audio file. The recording file supports the following formats only:
WAV: Higher audio fidelity, larger file size. For example, a 10-minute recording at 32000 Hz sampling rate is about 73 MB.
AAC: Lower audio fidelity, smaller file size. For example, a 10-minute recording at 32000 Hz sampling rate and AudioRecordingQualityMedium quality is about 2 MB. Recording stops automatically when the user leaves the channel.

The SDK supports client-side audio recording during a call. After calling this method, you can record the audio of users in the channel and obtain a recording file. The recording file only supports the following formats:
WAV: Higher audio fidelity and larger file size. For example, at a sample rate of 32000 Hz, a 10-minute recording is approximately 73 MB.
AAC: Lower audio fidelity and smaller file size. For example, at a sample rate of 32000 Hz and recording quality set to audioRecordingQualityMedium, a 10-minute recording is approximately 2 MB. The recording automatically stops when the user leaves the channel.

The SDK supports client-side recording during a call. After calling this method, you can record the audio of users in the channel and get a recording file. The recording file supports the following formats only:
WAV: High audio fidelity, large file size. For example, a file with 32000 Hz sample rate and 10 minutes duration is about 73 MB.
AAC: Lower audio fidelity, smaller file size. For example, a file with 32000 Hz sample rate and AUDIO_RECORDING_QUALITY_MEDIUM quality and 10 minutes duration is about 2 MB. Recording automatically stops when the user leaves the channel.
